result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abimelec Jose Torres

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Abimelec Jose Torres.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin.

Case in court for a calendar call.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Abimelec Jose Torres.  Attorney James C Griffin not in court. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Mr. Torres does not appear.  Court scheduled a calendar call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference before Branch 19.
Per email from Ada Griffin this case should be tabbed to Branch 2.
Court ordered case transferred. Parties notiifed case will be placed on Branch 2 Calendar.
Scheduling Conference 9-29-2022 at 8:30am- Branch 2

Adjourned Off the record. Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Defendant in custody. Defense counsel in trial in a different court. 
Court ordered matter adjourned. Parties advised of the new date via email.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court, in custody.  
Erika Strebel for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense request an addtional status date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 9 pages) commencing 07-06-2022 by SANDRA M. KANDZIORA.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF4057. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Schmitz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. Defense counsel unable to appear due to a family emergency. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Caroline Pellegrino appears for the State of Wisconsin under student practice rules and under the supervision of ADA William R. F. Ackell. Attorney Sargent appeared by video means prior to case being called. Attorney Sargent has been recently appointed. Case is adjourned in preliminary hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE HEARING in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Abimelec Jose Torres in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Abimelec Jose Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
